attributes.action: apologise for financial regulatory mismanagement in his time as Chancellor of the Exchequer and as Prime Minsiter
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Prime Minister's financial reforms as chancellor and handling of the economic crisis as Prime Minister, including transferring the power of banking supervision from the Bank of England to the F.S.A., mishandling Northern Rock and other banks,  commissioning bankers such as Sir Fred Goodwin from those failed banks to spearhead Government reports and institutions including the F.S.A., and running irresponsible budget deficits during periods of prosperity, have directly and irreversibly damaged Britain's economy, to the extent that Business Monitor International has stated that "Britain is facing an unprecedented fall in its economic world ranking… from 12th place in 2007 to 21st in 2010."

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
